questions.question_text:
You are the admin of an Autonomous Database (ADB) instance, and a new developer has requested a new workspace in APEX.
What statement describes the step to provide the developer a new workspace in APEX? (Choose the best answer.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B is correct.
For me it's A thanks
B https://docs.oracle.com/en/database/oracle/application-express/19.1/htmig/creating-workspace-and-adding-Oracle-AE-users.html#GUID-1040F145-452A-49D4-BCF6-A80851AFFA74

Create a New Instance Administrator
Login to the INTERNAL workspace as the ADMIN user, or another existing admin user.
Click the "Create User" link on the right-hand menu.
For a new admin user enter mandatory items and the following.
Workspace : INTERNAL
Default Schema : APEX_180200 {or whatever the highest version is}
User is an administrator: Yes
Account Availability : Unlocked
Password and Confirmation Password.
Require Change of Password on First Use : Yes
Click the "Create User" button.

https://oracle-base.com/articles/misc/apex-tips-basic-apex-management

choices.C: Create a database user with the APEX role.
choices.D: Create an IDCS user with the APEX role.
choices.B: Access the APEX Administration Services and create the workspace for the developer.

Data Safe works with the following Oracle Databases

− Exadata DB systems
− Database Cloud Service on Virtual Machine
− Database Cloud Service on Bare Metal
− Oracle Database on Compute

if Data Safe supports more than just Autonmous DBs, then answer is not C.

Answer should be D, Data Discovery helps you find sensitive data in your databases. You tell Data Discovery what kind of sensitive data to search for, and it inspects the actual data in your database and its data dictionary, and then returns to you a list of sensitive columns. By default, Data Discovery can search for a wide variety of sensitive data pertaining to identification, biographic, IT, financial, healthcare, employment, and academic information.

https://docs.oracle.com/en/cloud/paas/data-safe/udscs/oracle-data-safe-overview.html#GUID-9F88DA55-A3A5-48FE-8138-8E52A1B26910

choices.A: Oracle Data Safe helps you assess the security of your cloud database configurations by analyzing database configurations.
choices.B: Oracle Data Safe evaluates user types, how users are authenticated, and the password policies assigned to each user.
choices.C: Oracle Data Safe only supports Autonomous Databases.
choices.D: Oracle Data Safe helps you find sensitive data in your database by inspecting the actual data in your database and its data dictionary.

questions.question_text:
Oracle Data Safe is a unified control center for your Oracle databases which helps you understand the sensitivity of your data, evaluate risks to data, mask sensitive data, implement and monitor security controls, assess user security, monitor user activity, and address data security compliance requirements.
Which statement is FALSE? (Choose the best answer.)
Which statement is true when you provision an Autonomous Database using the cloning method? (Choose the best answer.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A is correct.

A and D Are Correct!
A = "In the Clone source area, select one of:Clone from database instance: This creates a clone from a running database."
D = "Note:After you clone your Autonomous Database you can change the network access option you select for the cloned instance."
Source:

A. A clone database source can be a running database instance is true when you provision an Autonomous Database using the cloning method.

When you use the cloning method to provision an Autonomous Database, you can choose an existing database instance as the source for the clone. The source database can be a running database instance or a backup. When you choose a running instance, a backup is created automatically, and the clone is created from that backup.

Option B is not entirely correct because there is no time limit on the age of the backup used for cloning an Autonomous Database.

Option C is not entirely correct because only the data and schema are cloned from the source database to the new database. Workspaces, projects, and notebooks are not cloned.

Option D is not entirely correct because you cannot change the network access option after the Autonomous Database has been created using a clone.

The Question is wrong was suppose to ask the wrong statement. Making the correction to the question, the answer is B. as there is no point in time back up rather point in time recovery. The rest of the chooses are correct statements
https://docs.oracle.com/en/cloud/paas/autonomous-database/adbsa/autonomous-clone-backup.html#GUID-20D2D970-0CB4-472F-BF89-1EE769BFB5E8
https://docs.oracle.com/en-us/iaas/Content/Database/Tasks/adbcloning.htm

Based on the doc https://docs.oracle.com/en/cloud/paas/autonomous-database/adbsa/autonomous-clone.html#GUID-68199DE6-CD45-4A6D-8EE6-1D95D45C8B1A
D is correct.
After you clone your Autonomous Database you can change the network access option you select for the cloned instance.
A is possible, but i had created a clone (testing) and y can modify the network access, D is correct too.
A is correct

choices.C: When cloning an Autonomous Database, Oracle Machine Learning workspaces, projects, and notebooks of the source database are cloned to the new database.
choices.D: After an Autonomous database is created using a clone, the network access option can be changed.
choices.A: A clone database source can be a running database instance.
choices.B: A clone database source can be from a point-in-time backup that is less than 2 hours old.
